data.title: Electronic Arts
data.meta_description: Electronic Arts - Video game developers focused on core games. Public Company. Raised funding from 11 investors. Founded by Jeff Burton and Trip Hawkins in the year 1982. Electronic Arts has 2286 competitors.

Electronic Arts - About the company

What does Electronic Arts do?

Video game developers focused on core games. The company has developed and published games for all formats and platforms including PCs, mobile devices, consoles, Facebook games, and web games. The company has developed several franchises including SimCity, Sims, NBA, FIFA, NFS, and more.

Which sectors and market segments does Electronic Arts operate in?

Electronic Arts serves in the B2C space in the Mobile, Gaming market segments.

The primary business model of Electronic Arts are :Mobile > Mobile Gaming > ***** **** > ***** ******Gaming > Mobile Gaming > ***** **** > ***** ******Gaming > PC & Console Gaming > ***** **** > ***** ******

Electronic Arts's IPO details

Electronic Arts got listed on National Association of Securities Dealers Automated Quotations ( NASDAQ ) on Sep 20, 1989.

Click here to take a look at Electronic Arts 's IPO in detail

Electronic Arts's funding and investors

How much funding has Electronic Arts raised till date?

Electronic Arts is a funded company.

Who are Electronic Arts's investors?

Electronic Arts has 11 institutional investor s including TCV, Kleiner Perkins and Glynn Capital.

View details of Electronic Arts funding rounds and investors

Electronic Arts's founders and board of directors

Founder? Claim Profile

Who are the founders of Electronic Arts?

The founders of Electronic Arts are Jeff Burton and Trip Hawkins.

Who is the current CEO of Electronic Arts?

Andrew Wilson is the CEO of Electronic Arts .

How many employees does Electronic Arts have?

Electronic Arts has 13,400 employees as of Mar 23. The total employee count is 3.9% more than what it was in Mar 22.

Uncover Electronic Arts's growth story! Sign up today!

Electronic Arts's Competitors and alternates

Who are the competitors of Electronic Arts?

Top competitor s of Electronic Arts include Animoca Brands, Riot Games and Krafton.

Electronic Arts ranks 3 rd among 1789 active competitors. 221 of its competitors are funded while 274 have exited. Overall, Electronic Arts and its competitors have raised over $9.22B in funding across 667 funding rounds involving 1467 investors. There are 9 private unicorns, 73 public and 201 acquired companies in the entire competition set.

Frequently asked questions about Electronic Arts

When was Electronic Arts founded?

Electronic Arts was founded in 1982.

Where is Electronic Arts located?

Electronic Arts is located in Redwood City, United States.

Is Electronic Arts a public company?

Electronic Arts is a public company, it went public on Sep 20, 1989.

What is the annual revenue of Electronic Arts?

Annual revenue of Electronic Arts is $24.9K as on Mar 31, 2022.

Is Electronic Arts a Mobile Gaming company?

The primary sectors of Electronic Arts are Mobile Gaming and PC & Console Gaming.
